title: Mason Cycles Drop Bar MTB InSearchOf Becomes ISO2
content:
Mason Cycles first launched its InSearchOf drop-bar 29er mountain bike in 2019 and it quickly became an in-demand bike for gravel, mountain bike and touring disciplines for the brand. Now, in 2025, the suspension corrected drop-bar mountain bike got a few concerted updates, along with a new name, the ISO2. Let’s check it out…

Mason Cycles 2025 ISO2 Updates & Quick Hits

  • MASON-designed CNC dropouts, with Universal Derailleur Hanger
  • Specially ported T47 bottom bracket with outboard bearings, giving high durability, a
    stable pedalling platform and smooth internal routing for dropper cable and brake hose
  • Revised and refined hose and cable routing
  • Top tube mounts for secure bag and accessory mounting
  • MASON HotShoe2 carbon fork, with optimised internal routing and strengthened and
    repositioned equipment mounts
  • 2 colors new to the ISO: GrigioTecno and FilterYellow

Colors

The ISO2 boasts two of the most popular colour options in the MASON palette: FilterYellow offers a vivid mustardy look, while GrigioTecno is an industrial blueish-grey. Frames receive anti-corrosion treatment, inside and out, before painting. Anniversary Decade of Details graphics finish the look.

InSearchOf Features Carried Through to the New ISO2:

  • Custom-formed progressive-butted Dedacciai Zero and Reynolds 853 steel
  • Hand-built in Italy
  • Choice of 29” or 650B wheels
  • 29 x 2.6” or 27.5 x 2.9” tyre clearance
  • 100mm suspension fork compatibility, with corrected geometry
  • Boost spacing, for the stiffness and strength of mountain bike hubs
  • Unique MASON Shutter load-bearing fender
  • MASON Condenser direct-mount rack (option)
  • Tri-mount system for mounting Shutter or Condenser, unique to the HotShoe and HotShoe2 fork

Pricing

The MASON ISO2 is available with a variety of groupset, wheel and component options. Multiple versions of the ISO2 can be configured via the MASON website, or through direct discussion with MASON to create a truly custom spec.
The ISO2 comes with MASON’s own Shutter load-bearing fender. The Condenser front rack is available as an optional extra.

Suspension fork options include RockShox, with other models such as Fox available. Bikes built with a suspension fork have the option to be supplied with an additional MASON HotShoe2 fork, enabling the ISO2 to be set up for any challenge.

Example Prices:

  • Frameset, with HotShoe2 carbon fork – from £1,795 inc. VAT
  • Shimano GRX/XT, with HotShoe2 carbon fork– from £3,000 inc. VAT
  • Shimano GRX/XT, with RockShox SID SL Ultimate Race Day – from £3,600 inc. VAT SRAM GX, with HotShoe2 carbon
  • fork – from £4,095 inc. VAT
  • SRAM GX, with RockShox SID SL Ultimate Race Day – from £4,695 inc. VAT
